lead_paragraph: John Dunne, who spent the past five seasons as an assistant coach under Louis Orr at Seton Hall, was introduced yesterday as the new men's coach at St. Peter's. Dunne, a Queens native, is a graduate of Archbishop Molloy High School, where he played in the backcourt alongside Kenny Anderson, a former N.B.A. all-star. Dunne spent 12 years as an assistant, including stints at the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference members Siena (1999-2001) and Manhattan (1998-99).
